title: Grounded Theory-Based Medical Education Model Design Course for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and human anatomy
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented educational course conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Being able to explain the four-stage process of grounded theory methodology for designing medical education models
Being able to perform educational model development procedures using qualitative research methodologies (open coding, axial coding, selective coding)
Being able to write educational model evaluation reports applying statistical verification techniques (frequency analysis, mean/standard deviation calculation)
Being able to construct a model design framework consisting of six categories and 33 sub-elements by analyzing real-world data from medical education settings

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
